intro: Piper flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and medicinal research.
